result.markdown:
---
title: "AIC, BIC, and Deviance"
author: "Luke Miratrix"
editor: 
  markdown: 
    wrap: sentence
---




In this section, we briefly walk through how to find AIC, BIC, and Deviance to compare models.
We have a simple multilevel dataset (we generate through a utility package, `blkvar`, that Miratrix and the C.A.R.E.S. lab has used to explore how multilevel modeling works in practice), and generate a few variables that we will use as predictors.
Only the fourth variable is actually useful for prediction!
Let's see if our AIC, etc., measures identify which model is superior.

To install a "working package" we use `devtools`:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
devtools::install_github("https://github.com/lmiratrix/blkvar" )
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library( blkvar )
dd = generate_multilevel_data( J = 40 )
head( dd )
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
  sid         Y0         Y1 Z       Yobs         W
1   1  0.2856327  0.3725000 1  0.3725000 0.6909827
2   1 -0.5831954 -0.4963281 1 -0.4963281 0.6909827
3   1  1.4709673  1.5578346 0  1.4709673 0.6909827
4   1  1.4066882  1.4935556 0  1.4066882 0.6909827
5   1  0.9243388  1.0112061 1  1.0112061 0.6909827
6   1  0.7640368  0.8509041 0  0.7640368 0.6909827
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
dd$X1 = rnorm( nrow(dd) )
dd$X2 = rnorm( nrow(dd) )
dd$X3 = rnorm( nrow(dd) )
dd$X4 = dd$Yobs + rnorm(nrow(dd))
 
M1 = lmer( Yobs ~ 1 + (1|sid), data=dd )
M2 = lmer( Yobs ~ 1 + X1 + X2 + X3 + (1|sid), data=dd )
M3 = lmer( Yobs ~ 1 + X1 + X2 + X3 + X4 + (1|sid), data=dd )

library( arm )
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```

```
:::


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
display(M1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
lmer(formula = Yobs ~ 1 + (1 | sid), data = dd)
coef.est  coef.se 
    0.01     0.14 

Error terms:
 Groups   Name        Std.Dev.
 sid      (Intercept) 0.84    
 Residual             0.61    
---
number of obs: 413, groups: sid, 40
AIC = 886.2, DIC = 875.9
deviance = 878.1 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
display(M2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
lmer(formula = Yobs ~ 1 + X1 + X2 + X3 + (1 | sid), data = dd)
            coef.est coef.se
(Intercept)  0.01     0.14  
X1          -0.01     0.03  
X2          -0.01     0.03  
X3          -0.04     0.03  

Error terms:
 Groups   Name        Std.Dev.
 sid      (Intercept) 0.84    
 Residual             0.61    
---
number of obs: 413, groups: sid, 40
AIC = 905.2, DIC = 858.3
deviance = 875.7 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library( texreg )
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Version:  1.38.6
Date:     2022-04-06
Author:   Philip Leifeld (University of Essex)

Consider submitting praise using the praise or praise_interactive functions.
Please cite the JSS article in your publications -- see citation("texreg").
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
screenreg( list( M1, M2, M3 ) )
```

```

-----------------------------------------------------

                        (0.14)    (0.14)    (0.09)

                                  (0.03)    (0.03)   
X2                                -0.01     -0.01    
                                  (0.03)    (0.03)   
X3                                -0.04     -0.02    
                                  (0.03)    (0.03)   
X4                                           0.32 ***
                                            (0.02)   
-----------------------------------------------------
AIC                    886.22    905.21    750.31    
BIC                    898.29    929.35    778.48

Num. groups: sid        40        40        40
```
